alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 8:59AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of Boyd, Lawrence, southeastern Carter, southeastern Lawrence, southwestern Mason, Cabell, southwestern Putnam, northwestern Lincoln and Wayne Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 858 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms near Beech Fork State Park, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor water problems could be possible. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Louisa, Wayne, Hamlin, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Cannonsburg, Grayson Lake State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Hurricane, Barboursville, Kenova, Milton, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Fort Gay, Denton and Burnaugh. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 182 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
